intro: Nothopegia racemosa var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed nothopegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family, which includes a variety of grass-like plants adapted to fire-prone environments. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences that bloom in spring. It typically grows in coastal and mountainous regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical characteristics make it an important component of the fynbos vegetation in its native habitat.
